Show reduction targets for all tilt_subsectors per scenario-year benchmark

Source: R/show_reduction_targets_for_tilt_subsectors_per_scenario_year.R
show_reduction_targets_for_tilt_subsectors_per_scenario_year.Rd

This function shows reduction targets for all tilt_subsectors per scenario-year benchmark using product-level output of Sector profile indicator.

Usage

show_reduction_targets_for_tilt_subsectors_per_scenario_year(sector_product)

Arguments

sector_product

A dataframe. Product-level output of Sector profile

Value

A dataframe

Examples

library(dplyr)
sector_product_example <- product_sector |>
  select(c("tilt_subsector", "scenario", "year", "reduction_targets")) |>
  distinct()
sector_product_example
#> # A tibble: 12 × 4
#>    tilt_subsector           scenario  year reduction_targets
#>    <chr>                    <chr>    <dbl>             <dbl>
#>  1 construction residential 1.5C RPS  2030              0.18
#>  2 construction residential 1.5C RPS  2050              0.98
#>  3 construction residential NZ 2050   2030              0.4 
#>  4 construction residential NZ 2050   2050              0.97
#>  5 other metals             1.5C RPS  2030              0.09
#>  6 other metals             1.5C RPS  2050              0.95
#>  7 other metals             NZ 2050   2030              0.22
#>  8 other metals             NZ 2050   2050              0.96
#>  9 iron & steel             1.5C RPS  2030              0.22
#> 10 iron & steel             1.5C RPS  2050              0.96
#> 11 iron & steel             NZ 2050   2030              0.23
#> 12 iron & steel             NZ 2050   2050              0.94

show_reduction_targets_for_tilt_subsectors_per_scenario_year(
  sector_product_example
)
#> # A tibble: 3 × 5
#>   tilt_subsector           IPR_2030 IPR_2050 WEO_2030 WEO_2050
#>   <chr>                       <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
#> 1 construction residential     0.18     0.98     0.4      0.97
#> 2 other metals                 0.09     0.95     0.22     0.96
#> 3 iron & steel                 0.22     0.96     0.23     0.94
